patient_info: Abnormality of refraction,Visual loss,Cafe-au-lait spot,Cranial hyperostosis,Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins,Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia,Abnormal shape of the occiput
golden_diagnosis: McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic
predict_diagnosis:
Abnormality of refraction and visual loss
Cafe-au-lait spots: can be associated with various diseases such as nephropharambotic osteonecrosis (NOPO), Marfan syndrome, and Fanconi anemia.
Cranial hyperostosis: associated with osteoclast-granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor receptor-activating mutations (ORCA1/ORCA2 mutations) and inborn errors of metabolism.
Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins: can be associated with growth hormone excess, skeletal dysplasias like polyostotic fibrous dysplasia, or congenital disorders of lysosomes such as Pompe disease.
Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia: characterized by the proliferation of fibrous tissue in bones and can present as enlarged and deformed bones.
Abnormal shape of the occiput: may be associated with craniosynostosis, a condition caused by premature fusion of cranial sutures.
Melanoma: dark spots or moles with irregular borders can be indicative of melanoma, a type of skin cancer.
Neurofibromas: fibrous tissue nodules that can develop in various areas of the body and can be associated with neurofibrominosis type 1 or type 2.
Pituitary hyperfunction: abnormality in refraction and visual loss can be a sign of hyperthyroidism or other pituitary hormone excesses.
Lysosomal storage disorders: can cause osteoclast activation and resulting bone pain or enlargement.
Osteomyelitis: infection of bones and can present with bone pain, fever, and deformity.
